events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application online to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan system automatically categorised the application under personal loans due to the presence of medical and debt-related keywords.
A loan officer was assigned promptly to assist with the personal loan application and guide the applicant through the process.
The loan officer performed an initial review of the application, verifying the applicant’s stated purposes including medical bills and debt consolidation.
Additional documents were requested to support the personal loan application, including recent medical bills and proof of existing debts.
The applicant submitted all requested documents timely, enabling the loan officer to continue processing the request without delays.
Credit check was completed showing the applicant’s credit score and history, which is borderline but acceptable for this loan category.
The risk assessment evaluated the financial situation related to the applicant’s medical debts and overall repayment ability.
An offer was presented to the applicant outlining the loan amount, interest rate, and repayment schedule tailored to their financial needs.
The applicant responded positively to the offer, requesting minor adjustments in the repayment terms to better suit their income flow.
Due to the requested changes in the loan terms, the application was escalated to a senior loan manager for final approval.
The senior manager approved the adjusted personal loan, confirming the new repayment schedule and terms requested by the applicant.
Funds from the approved personal loan were disbursed to the applicant’s account as per the agreed schedule.
A follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant is satisfied with the loan setup and to answer any questions regarding repayment.
The personal loan application case was officially closed after all funding and follow-up steps were successfully completed.
